poem:
Trade Reflection

In the morning's paper,  
I read of tariffs, those  
walled whispers between  
neighboring lands.  

Trump, champion of the oval,  
stance firm like a soldiered bookend,  
yields to the gravity of a camera's click,  
his bluster tucked in a suit pocket—  
for later fumbling  
at dinnertalk.
